issueDTO.title: [MCP] ClickSend SMS
issueDTO.description:
## 🧩 Product Overview  

ClickSend is a cloud-based messaging platform for sending SMS, MMS, voice, email, and more. This integration allows automation builders and AI agents to send messages, manage contacts, and monitor communication status across workflows.

---

## ⚠️ Important Note for Contributors  

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

---

## 🚨 Triggers  

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **New Incoming SMS** | Start a workflow when a new SMS is received (e.g., customer support, lead inquiry).|

---

## 🛠️ Write Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Send SMS** | Send one or more SMS messages to customers, leads, or internal users. |
| **Send MMS** |  Send event posters or product images.|
|**Create Contact**|Capture webinar registrations into SMS lists.|
|**Update Contact**| Keep contact details current after CRM sync.|
|**Delete Contact**|Opt-out contacts automatically when unsubscribed.|
|**Create Contact List** | Set up segmented marketing lists automatically.|

---

## 🔍 Search Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |
|:------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Search Contact by Email Address** | Retrieves a contact in a list by email.|
|**Search Contact by Phone**| Retrieves a contact in a list by phone number.|
|**Search Contact Lists**| Check if a marketing list exists before adding contacts.|

---


## 📚 API Reference  
- [Official ClickSend API Documentation](https://developers.clicksend.com/docs#ClickSend-v3-API-SMS)

---

## 🧪 Test Account Access  
Sign up for a free account at [ClickSend Signup](https://dashboard.clicksend.com/#/signup/step0).

---

## 🧑‍💻 New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are built with our TypeScript framework and are easy to develop. Once merged into our repository, they become available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs usable by AI agents and MCP clients.

Start building here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)
comments: AP-789 [MCP] ClickSend SMS
/bounty $100

## 💎 $100 bounty [• Activepieces (YC S22)](https://algora.io/activepieces)
### Steps to solve:
1. **Start working**: Comment `/attempt #8234` with your implementation plan
2. **Submit work**: Create a pull request including `/claim #8234` in the PR body to claim the bounty
3. **Receive payment**: 100% of the bounty is received 2-5 days post-reward. [Make sure you are eligible for payouts](https://algora.io/docs/payments#supported-countries-regions)

### ❗ Important guidelines:
- 🔍 Before starting, please check if someone is already working on the bounty by reviewing existing comments and pull requests to avoid duplicated efforts. Only one pull request will be merged per bounty, based on overall quality, completeness, adherence to guidelines, and maintainability of the code.
- To claim a bounty, you need to **provide a short demo video** of your changes in your pull request
- If anything is unclear, **ask for clarification** before starting as this will help avoid potential rework
- Low quality AI PRs will not receive review and will be closed
- Do not ask to be assigned unless you've contributed before

Thank you for contributing to activepieces/activepieces!

issueDTO.title: [azuremonitorreceiver] Collect metrics labels from Azure Resource tags
issueDTO.description:
### Component(s)

receiver/azuremonitor

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

For FinOps consideration, we need to count TS coming from each resources / subscriptions.


### Describe the solution you'd like

We have already a tag "service" on all our Azure resources. 

We need to map this "service" tag into "service" metrics labels so that we can then easily count TS for each service.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Tip

<sub>[React](https://github.blog/news-insights/product-news/add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) with 👍 to help prioritize this issue. Please use comments to provide useful context, avoiding `+1` or `me too`, to help us triage it. Learn more [here](https://opentelemetry.io/community/end-user/issue-participation/).</sub>
comments: /labels receiver/azuremonitor -needs-triage good-first-issue

Pinging code owners for receiver/azuremonitor: @nslaughter @celian-garcia @ishleenk17. See [Adding Labels via Comments](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-labels-via-comments) if you do not have permissions to add labels yourself. For example, comment '/label priority:p2 -needs-triaged' to set the priority and remove the needs-triaged label.
/labels never-stale

Hi @celian-garcia Would it be okay if I take on this issue?
Also, I’d really appreciate it if you could provide a more detailed explanation of the problem and the expected solution?

😲 I feel bad. Checking the implementation to give you details, I actually found out that something was already existing but not documented. 

Following config
```yaml
append_tags_as_attributes: true
```
Is getting all the tags of the scraped resource and append them with label tags_{tag}={tag_value}

Despite this would work, I would like to have a bit more control. Some tags could have a uncontrolled cardinality. 

So what I propose would be to turn that field into a list (breaking change are okish since it's alpha)
Similar to what has been done there https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/receiver/azuremonitorreceiver/README.md#filtering-metrics
```yaml
append_tags_as_attributes: [*] # takes every tag
append_tags_as_attributes: ["service", "something"] # takes only tags service and something
```
@Angith don't hesitate to tell me if you want more precisions.
Thanks @celian-garcia. Let me go through it and come back to you.
@celian-garcia can I work on this
Well @Angith said he would check so I believe it's fair to give him some days.
@celian-garcia I caught up with some other work. Currently, I am working on this issue. I will give you an update by the end of this week. 🙂

repository.description: Contrib repository for the OpenTelemetry Collector
repository.name: opentelemetry-collector-contrib

summary.main: The objective of the issue is to collect metrics labels from Azure Resource tags for FinOps consideration, specifically to count TS coming from each resource/subscriptions.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to map the 'service' tag from Azure resources to 'service' metrics labels so that TS can be easily counted for each service.
summary.attemptedFixes: The contributor has found that a similar feature already exists in the Azure Monitor receiver, but it's not documented. They also mention that they've caught up with other work and will provide an update by the end of the week.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to collecting metrics labels from Azure Resource tags for FinOps consideration. The existing implementation appends all tags as attributes, but the contributor wants more control over which tags are included. They propose a list-based approach for filtering tags, similar to the filtering-metrics feature.

issueDTO.title: Some text on the p5.js Editor “About” page is not translated
issueDTO.description:
### p5.js version

2.0.1

### What is your operating system?

Windows

### Web browser and version

Chrome Version 136.0.7103.93

### Actual Behavior

When viewing the “About” page of the p5.js Editor in a non-English language (e.g., Spanish), some sections still display text in English. This includes the introductory paragraph and various descriptions under sections like “Get Involved” and “Resources,” which remain untranslated even though the rest of the UI is localized.

### Expected Behavior

All static text on the “About” page should be fully translated and displayed in the selected language, ensuring a consistent and complete user experience across all supported locales.

### Steps to reproduce

### Steps:
1. Open a sketch in the web editor.
2. Select the language other than english.
3. Go to Help section and click on About.

issueDTO.title: feat: Add `timeoutSec` at step level
issueDTO.description:
### What

Add `timeoutSec` at step level.

### Problem
DAG-level timeout applies to all steps equally. Different steps need different timeouts:
- API calls: seconds
- Data processing: hours
- Health checks: seconds

### Example
```yaml
steps:
  - name: health-check
    command: curl -f https://api.example.com
    timeoutSec: 5
    
  - name: process-data
    command: python heavy_job.py
    timeoutSec: 3600
```

### Current
- Timeout only in DAG struct
comments: Hi, I can work on this issue.
Hi @saishreyakumar, thank you very much for taking on this issue. Assigned to you. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

Hi @saishreyakumar, since you seem to be a bit busy at the moment, I’ll go ahead and unassign you for now. Feel free to reach out anytime if you find the time to work on this issue. Thanks again for your interest in contributing!

issueDTO.title: Add UI backdrop opacity control
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
F3D has a simple ImGui based UI which feature a backdrop for readability.
However this backdrop opacity is hardcode to 0.35, which may make the text unreadable depending on the background or HDRI.

F3D used to adapt text color automatically but this is not the case anymore as the backdrop makes the text readable at all time. But it would be nice to provide a way to control the opacity of the backdrop.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 - Remove the non-functionnal "IsBackgroundDark" logic and associated tests
 - Add a libf3d option and CLI option `ui.backdrop.opacity`
 - Implement the logic to control the opacity in vtkF3DUIActor, vtkF3DImGUIActor and vtkF3DRenderer
 - Add testing and doc
comments: hi this is ray from the discord server, would love to work on this
Of course! Assigned.

issueDTO.title: Add support for block data from itemtype
issueDTO.description:
### Suggestion

Add itemtype support to `block data of %block%`

### Why?

Bukkit allows the creation of block data from a block or material, some people do not have a block reference.
And with skript not having a widely known system to get an itemtype from blockdata (`type of coak_ore[]`) I believe a better alternative is to simply allow itemtypes to be used within `block data of...` syntax.

### Other

_No response_

### Agreement

- [X] I have read the guidelines above and affirm I am following them with this suggestion.
comments: Seems like something I could do

@nylhus This has been on my todo list, but you can take it.

Essentially you would use the [BlockStateMeta ](https://jd.papermc.io/paper/1.20/org/bukkit/inventory/meta/BlockStateMeta.html) in Bukkit and apply it to an itemstack.
I have the exact syntax in Khoryl, and I was planning to add to Skript eventually. https://github.com/TheLimeGlass/Khoryl/blob/master/src/main/java/me/limeglass/khoryl/elements/item/EffApplyBlockStateItem.java

This allows for
```vb
set {_shield} to a shield
target block is a lime standing banner #can have banner patterns
apply the block state from the target block of player to {_shield}
set the offhand of the player to {_shield}
```

Do note that using itemtypes in the pattern does not work properly. I would recommend making it itemstack only!
ItemType's store their ItemMeta until applied to an ItemStack, and when we utilized this syntax, we found out that itemtypes did not save the block state for some reason.

For this reason, I made it an expression which acts just like ExprLore and applies it like an expression returning the ItemStack. (Changes not applied to the Khoryl remote repo yet)

Similarly to BlockStateMeta there is also BlockDataMeta which is essentially the exact same class just for BlockData.

I believe the BlockStateMeta is off topic for what I wanted this suggest to be. You're taking it as should we add it to `give player westward facing oak stairs` all I want here is `send blockdata of westward facing oak stairs`. The addition of that should be left to another issue or pr.

> I believe the BlockStateMeta is off topic for what I wanted this suggest to be. You're taking it as should we add it to `give player westward facing oak stairs` all I want here is `send blockdata of westward facing oak stairs`. The addition of that should be left to another issue or pr.

They're very close to being the same class and the implementation is the same, it's a developer note.

I don't see how it's the same class, you're modifying 1 class not multiple. It's just going to ExprBlockData and adding itemtype and it's usage. You're suggesting it being done directly to ItemType class from what I understand

> I don't see how it's the same class, you're modifying 1 class not multiple. It's just going to ExprBlockData and adding itemtype and it's usage. You're suggesting it being done directly to ItemType class from what I understand

No, I said it shouldn't be done with ItemType.

Alright, so now I'm even further confused what you're talking about after rereading it.

1. This suggest is to add `block data of %itemtype%` nothing about BlockStates 
2. if any form of change to item meta is to happen it's BlockDataMeta to support `westward facing oak stairs` to also fix issues like `give play oak wall sign` not giving an item, which I repeat is better for a whole other issue and pr.
3. Your idea is way off of what I want this issue to even do...and am very confused where you got it from this.

> Alright, so now I'm even further confused what you're talking about after rereading it.
> 
>     1. This suggest is to add `block data of %itemtype%` nothing about BlockStates
> 
>     2. if any form of change to item meta is to happen it's BlockDataMeta to support `westward facing oak stairs` to also fix issues like `give play oak wall sign` not giving an item, which I repeat is better for a whole other issue and pr.
> 
>     3. Your idea is way off of what I want this issue to even do...and am very confused where you got it from this.

BlockStateMeta and BlockDataMeta are very similar classes. I have an existing example using BlockStateMeta for banner data.

I get that this suggestion is BlockDataMeta, I'm helping aid an example of usage, you just swap BlockStateMeta for BlockDataMeta.

issueDTO.title: [python-package] [R-package] every test catching an error should check for a specific error message
issueDTO.description:
## Description

Unit tests that assert that an error occurs should check that **a specific error** is raised.

Like this in Python:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_engine.py#L782-L783

And this in R:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/R-package/tests/testthat/test_basic.R#L209-L215

## Benefits of this work

* prevents tests from accidentally passing in the presence of an unrelated and unexpected error

## Acceptance criteria

* R: every use of `expect_error()` and `expect_warning()` in tests should pass argument `regexp` to catch a specific error/warning
* Python: every use of `pytest.raises()` and `pytest.warns()` in tests should pass argument `match` to catch a specific error/warning, and should catch a more specific exception type than "Exception"

## Approach

Do not try to fix all of these at once. Pull requests only changing 1 or a small number at a time are preferred.

Python:

* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_basic.py#L274 (#6887)
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_basic.py#L281 (#6887)

* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_dask.py#L1047 (#6893)
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_dask.py#L1133 (#6955)
* [ ] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/e7c6c4371b5d725902a09a80b4d6c36e432a4381/tests/python_package_test/test_dask.py#L1233
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_engine.py#L2827 (#6925)
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_engine.py#L2830 (#6925)

* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_sklearn.py#L1628 (#6929)

R

* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/R-package/tests/testthat/test_Predictor.R#L190-L191 (#6931)
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/R-package/tests/testthat/test_dataset.R#L49 (#6931)
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/R-package/tests/testthat/test_dataset.R#L182-L184 (#6931)

## Notes

How to run the Python tests:

```shell
# build lib_lightgbm (just do this once)
cmake -B build -S .
cmake --build build --target _lightgbm -j4

# install Python package (do this every time you change Python code in the library)
sh build-python.sh install --precompile

# run tests
python tests/test_python_package
```

How to run the R tests:

```shell
sh build-cran-package.sh --no-build-vignettes
R CMD INSTALL ./lightgbm*.tar.gz
cd ./R-package/tests
Rscript testthat.R
```

For other questions on how to set up your development environment, see #6350 (and post questions there about the development process).
comments: @nicklamiller thanks so much for your help so far! There are just a few more of these left, could you help us finish this?

@jameslamb sure thing, all of these appear to be fixed except for the final `raises` in `test_dask.py`, which I've just opened a PR for. To help add the corr. PR in the issue [OP](https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/issues/6860#issue-2908975971) to the remaining unchecked `raises` by file: - `test_basic.py` - Remaining `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6893 - `test_dask.py` - First two `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6893 - Last `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6955 - `test_sklearn.py` - All `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6929 Also to enforce error messages when testing for errors in the future I believe we can: - Python package: Add [ruff's `PT011`](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/pytest-raises-too-broad/) to the `pyproject.toml` file - Alternatively, we could enforce the entire [flake8-pytest-style (`PT`)](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/#flake8-pytest-style-pt) collection of linters, though there are currently 27 related errors so if we want to enforce this we'd have to do a little work before updating the linting config for the sake of CI checks (please see "All PT Errors" below). Plus, some of these are naturally subjective styling so not sure if we necessarily want to enforce them. - R package: Keeping track of adding this linter to `lintr` in https://github.com/r-lib/lintr/issues/2870 - Doesn't currently exist for [`testthat` linters](https://lintr.r-lib.org/reference/pkg_testthat_linters.html) - If maintainers deem useful, I can add that in to `lintr` and afterwards update in this project and add that to the list of R linters we use So please let me know if you'd like me to make the immediate proposed change to the python linting config (adding `PT011`) and if so, if you'd like me to do it as part of this issue or open up a separate issue.

Oh great, thank you!!! I apologize, looks like I was not doing as good a job of keeping the list in the description up to date as I thought. I just updated all of those and approved  + merged #6955.

> _we could enforce the entire [flake8-pytest-style (PT)](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/#flake8-pytest-style-pt) collection of linters_
> _..._
> _ let me know if you'd like me to make the immediate proposed change to the python linting config_

Thanks so much for the thorough explanation. I love the idea of introducing `ruff`'s `PT011` to help enforce this stuff, and I'd support just immediately doing that (no need to create a new issue).

Looks like it even caught one overly-broad exception that I missed in this issue:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/e7c6c4371b5d725902a09a80b4d6c36e432a4381/tests/python_package_test/test_dask.py#L1233

I'd support PRs (or even a single PR, if you'd prefer) that introduced `PT` in the list here:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/e7c6c4371b5d725902a09a80b4d6c36e432a4381/python-package/pyproject.toml#L141

These look like some great suggestions... for example, only putting `with pytest.raises()` around the 1 statement that raises the exception is really helpful, and something @StrikerRUS has advised me on before. Would be great to enforce that automatically!

But please add the following to the `ignore` list

* "PT007 Wrong values type in `pytest.mark.parametrize` expected `list` of `tuple`"
  - *I do not really understand this one... a `tuple` is a little safer because it's immutable*
* "PT003 `scope='function'` is implied in `@pytest.fixture()`"
  - *I like being able to read the code and knowing it's a function-scoped fixture, not needing to remember what the default is*

> _I can add that in to lintr and afterwards update in this project and add that to the list of R linters we use_

Thanks for opening that `{lintr}` issue.

If that idea is accepted and implemented there, I'd support using it here in LightGBM. I understand and agree with some of the concerns @MichaelChirico raised there, but for `{lightgbm}` (where our `expect_error()` tests are mostly catching our own first-party error messages), I'd like this linter's help and I'd be willing to to pay the slight maintenance cost of `# nolint` comments on any `expect_error()` calls catching errors raised by other libraries.

Totally up to you if working on that in `{lintr}` interests you!

Thanks!

Yeah let's let #6959 close this issue. No need to create a new issue here for the `{lintr}` stuff, since that isn't even guaranteed to be merged... It would be ok with me if you just open a PR here in the future introducing the new linter(s) and bumping the version, similar to https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6471

Create, edit, and delete notes

Light and dark mode toggle

Organize notes by folders

Color-coded notes

Authentication and user profile

Note reminders and alerts (future scope)

Design Guidelines:
Use a clean and consistent layout

Follow the existing design system of the app (colors, typography, spacing)

Display features in card layout, grid, or a vertical list with section headings

Ensure responsiveness across screen sizes

issueDTO.title: Add `TotalNetIn` and other new fields to `rueidiscompat.ClientInfo`
issueDTO.description:
https://github.com/redis/redis/pull/13944 CLIENT INFO and CLIENT LIST have the following new fields:
1. tot-net-in: total network bytes read from the client connection
2. tot-net-out: total network bytes sent to the client connection
3. tot-cmds: number of commands executed by the client connection

We should add `TotalNetIn`, `TotalNetOut`, and `TotalCmds` to `rueidiscompat.ClientInfo` and fill the corresponding values.

See: https://github.com/redis/go-redis/pull/3409/files#diff-4d7d1923693fc5ce892add2ea2907a744e77ea0b50c1939ccc5067cb48a466a3R5200-R5202.

issueDTO.title: cleanup/remove interfaces.js from src/backend/src/services/drivers
issueDTO.description: The `interfaces.js` is where driver interfaces were registered at the beginning, but this wasn't a good approach because it doesn't make it possible for outside modules to define new driver interfaces. Support for registering driver interfaces from other modules was added later, for example the `puter-chat-completion` definition in that file isn't used and the real `puter-chat-completion` interface is [defined by this service](https://github.com/HeyPuter/puter/blob/main/src/backend/src/modules/puterai/AIInterfaceService.js) (as it should be). Some of the definitions in `interface.js` are still in use and need to be migrated to the new registration mechanism. I think it's just `crud-q` and maybe also `puter-analytics`. Then, this file should be removed.

issueDTO.title: Replace human-readable text with i18n keys
issueDTO.description:
For translation purposes, we need to replace all human-readable text in the UI components with `i18n(key)` calls. This will allow for easier localization in the future.

## Tasks
- [ ] Identify all human-readable text in files located under `./src/gui/src/UI`
- [ ] Replace each instance of human-readable text with `i18n(key)`
- [ ] Add corresponding translations for each key in `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js`

## Implementation Details
1. Go through each file in `./src/gui/src/UI`
2. For each human-readable string found:
   - Create a unique, descriptive key for the string
   - Replace the string with `i18n(key)`
   - Add the key-value pair to `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js`

## Example

Before:
```javascript
<button>Submit</button>
```

After:
```javascript
<button>{i18n('submit')}</button>
```
In `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js`:

```javascript
const en = {
    name: "English",
    english_name: "English",
    code: "en",
    dictionary: {
        // ... existing translations
        'submit_button_text': 'Submit',
        // ... existing translations
    }
}
```

## Additional Notes

- Ensure keys are descriptive and follow a consistent naming convention
- Be cautious with dynamic text or text that includes variables
- Consider context when creating keys to avoid potential conflicts

## Definition of Done

- All human-readable text in files under `./src/gui/src/UI` is replaced with `i18n(key)` calls.
- All new keys are added to `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js` with correct English translations.
- The application builds without errors and all UI elements display correctly.

issueDTO.title: [Feature] Make Infinistore Link Type Configurable
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Infinistore supports Ethernet and Infiniband, but LMCache hard-codes the link type to Ethernet when setting up its Infinistore connection. This limits the usefulness of the Infinistore backend.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to add a configuration parameter (maybe `infinistore_link` or `infinistore_link_type`) that allows choosing Ethernet or Infiniband at runtime.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Currently I work around this by editing the hard-coded link type value. This is not a great solution for folks who are not building from source.

**Additional context**
I am happy to make this change if maintainers agree it should be made.
comments: Hi, thanks for raising it. I'd like to work on this issue.

issueDTO.title: Can Terraform be used to enable Fleet/Integrations Keep Policies Up to Date?
issueDTO.description:
As the Fleet documentation mentions some integrations are installed (and maybe managed) by Fleet and some or all of them have an option in the 'Settings' tab of the integration to Keep integration up to date automatically.  Other integrations do not have this capability and would be updated manually when a new version is available.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/fleet/current/upgrade-integration.html#upgrade-integration-policies-automatically

Terraform providers offers an integration installation capability where an option for 'version' specifies a specific version.  This option is a type string.
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/elastic/elasticstack/latest/docs/resources/fleet_integration

Questions are:  1) Could an value of "latest" or some other string be used in place of a specific numbered version to 'enable' terraform to Keep the integration(s) up to date?  2)  Could the Fleet API with 'keepPoliciesUpToDate' option be used to set/enable all integrations across the board to be kept update to date automatically?  3)  Is it advisable to try this or would there be any known or unintended consequences that might occur thereby making it something not to do or attempt?

It seems that since some of the integrations have the keep up to date feature and some do not, that there is a reason that not all integrations already have this Fleet UI toggle button.
comments:
+1 - we just ran into a problem related the fleet integrations when upgrading our entire stack from 8.15 -> 8.18

I think because of the "auto update", the apm server integration got upgraded to 8.18 automatically, this broke our terraform state because it couldn't find the apm server integration 8.15.

We had to manipulate state to remove it, then found out that `terrafom import` is not supported for this resource type, so we had to manually go in kibana and delete the integration, so then terraform was able to proceed and create it.

This is really cumbersome
It's the first time we've ran into this because it's the first upgrade after we introduced terraform to manage our elastic stack.

Plus, I'm wondering if it's even worth to have the integrations controlled by terraform, because when you bump the version, terraform tries to remove the integration and add a new one, but this fails because you cannot remove integrations that have a policy assigned to it.

This really breaks the whole point of automating this.
As a paying customer, I'm really disappointed that the terraform provider just seem like an afterthought, and there is really no other good alternative to maintain a bunch of elastic/kibana internal resources through IaC

It is a reasonable question to be asked, if it does make sense to manage the fleet integrations with Terraform. We do it for one of our setups since roughly 9 months and there are some challenges attached to it. The main reason we still do it is, that it helps us to keep everything under control between the 3 deployments (dev, test, prod).

What we find challenging is to perform updates of the fleet integrations. We normally execute the update manually on dev and then "backport" the changes to Terraform by analyzing the differences in the execution plan. The main challenge there is rooted in the fact, that some of the properties (for example `vars`, if I recall correctly) are marked as sensitive in Terraform and therefore Terraform refuses to show the differences even if the property might not contain any sensitive value for some of the fleet integrations (where others actually do store sensitive values in this property). Since analyzing the differences in the JSON output of the Terraform plan became very painful (especially, since the values are JSON in JSON), we even built our own tool to assist with this (https://github.com/breml/tfreveal).

The bottom line is, that with the use of fleet integrations one faces the challange, that there are two different systems (Terraform and the install/update mechanism of Fleet), which change the state and therefore there is always drift, that one needs to handle in Terraform. Sofar we made it work, but compared with other systems, that we manage with Terraform, this is for sure one of the more painful ones.

issueDTO.title: Refactoring for Unit Test Access Controls
issueDTO.description:
Part of #12048

## Issue
After most of the Unit Test migration in #12048, there are a lot of inconsistencies in access control test methods. This is because we did not migrate the many convenient, abstracted, and commonly used access control test methods from `ui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java` to `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`.

After merging #13254, all of the access control test methods in `BaseActionTest.java` have been migrated. Hence, this issue aims to refactor the unit test access controls to use these convenient test methods.

## Progress
The progress for this refactoring can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IcB-viJMrIOknYoBYasBuRBK9qnwY0-doEK4_Eb24IA/edit?gid=0#gid=0). I (the author) will update it when completed PRs are merged proactively.

## Steps to Contribute

1. Choose test(s) to work on in the above Google Sheets link
2. Check that no on else have claimed the test cases to work on within the last 2 weeks, or that it has been completed by follow up PRs (but not updated in the sheets)
3. Comment on this issue to indicate that you'd like to contribute on the chosen test(s). Update your comment if you need more than 2 weeks so that other contributors don't overlap with your work.
4. Create a PR to refactor the unit test(s).
5. Submit the PR, with a link to this issue by starting the description with "Part of #13304"## Tips

- Understand the access control test methods in `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`, follow the refactoring in #13254
- Most of the access control testing logic in the migrated unit tests under `sqlui/webapi` follows the old unit tests under `ui/webapi`, so you may wish to reference the old unit test for help

We will do our best to reply and give you the go-ahead, but if we don't, feel free to submit a PR as long as there is no one else working on it.

If you need any clarifications on our [developer guide](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/index.html), or are facing issues that are not found in our [troubleshooting guide](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/troubleshooting-guide.html), please [post a message in our discussion forum](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/discussions).

issueDTO.title: Report a per-http call metric
issueDTO.description:
Checklist
 I agree to the terms within the [OpenFGA Code of Conduct](https://github.com/openfga/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
Describe the problem you'd like to have solved
Right now, the metrics we emit are per-SDK method call at the API level (e.g. BatchCheck is multiple metrics for each underlying Check).

Users want to keep track of each underlying http call

Describe the ideal solution
We should expose another metric fga-client.http_request.duration that is emitted per-http request sent by the SDK

Alternatives and current workarounds
No response

References

issueDTO.title: Run Helm unit-tests with `-shuffle=on` and `-count=n` (n > 1)
issueDTO.description:
`go test` by default runs unit tests once in a deterministic order.  Leading to:
1. deterministic order: tests relying on their order of execution to pass
2. running once: higher probability of flakey tests passing

Helm's unit tests have encountered both problems lately. Tests relying on running in a particular order, or being flakey.

Adding `-shuffle=on` and `-count=n` (for `n > 1`; perhaps 2 or 3, TBD) will improve these behaviors:

> -count n
	    Run each test, benchmark, and fuzz seed n times (default 1).
	    If -cpu is set, run n times for each GOMAXPROCS value.
	    Examples are always run once. -count does not apply to
	    fuzz tests matched by -fuzz.

> -shuffle off,on,N
	    Randomize the execution order of tests and benchmarks.
	    It is off by default. If -shuffle is set to on, then it will seed
	    the randomizer using the system clock. If -shuffle is set to an
	    integer N, then N will be used as the seed value. In both cases,
	    the seed will be reported for reproducibility.

https://pkg.go.dev/cmd/go/internal/test
comments: Note: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/30610 attempted to enable `-shuffle=on`. But immediately found tests which failed when run in random order.
can I work on this?

@7h3-3mp7y-m4n if you want I started working on this. But feel free to continue, it's still flaky. :) 

https://github.com/helm/helm/compare/main...benoittgt:helm:shuffle-test?expand=1

It's alright @benoittgt , it's all yours ;)
All the best :)

Careful if you work on this. It appears it breaks the Mac OS keychain. I had 3 settings wipe since yesterday, and it appears that the issue is happening to a test close to `TestTLSRegistryClientTestSuite/Test_4_Logout`. It calls [this in oras](https://github.com/oras-project/oras-go/blob/05a2b09cbf2eab1df691411884dc4df741ec56ab/registry/remote/credentials/registry.go#L63-L65) behind. I've lost some data settings in the battle.
For anyone who has a PR for this please take me and gjenkins8 we will be happy to review.
can i work on this??

@gjenkins8 Moving to `-count=2` adds about 2.5 minutes to the test run time in CI. It adds a bunch of time to the local test runs, too. This impacts the inner loop on development. What do we gain by doing this? It is worth it?

I noted this over at https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/31013#pullrequestreview-2975837738, too.

> [@gjenkins8](https://github.com/gjenkins8) Moving to `-count=2` adds about 2.5 minutes to the test run time in CI. It adds a bunch of time to the local test runs, too. This impacts the inner loop on development. What do we gain by doing this? It is worth it?
> 
> I noted this over at [#31013 (review)](https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/31013#pullrequestreview-2975837738), too.

The benefit is it will help prevent issues like https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/31016 :)

Yes, the downside is slower test runs. The trade-off being higher confidence we have no flakes.

I  think we can keep local test runs (by default) to continue to run with `-count=1` (the default) ie. `make unit-test`. And so no changes for local dev.

But given the frequency of flakey test runs, I do think it is worth it to run CI with `-count=2`. It will slow CI down, but flakey/buggy tests will likely fail checks. And if we have access to bigger build workers(?), I think that would help reduce the time (bigger workers = more CPUs = more tests running in parallel).

(ill put this comment on https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/31013#pullrequestreview-2975837738 as well)

The final option would be to only run with a higher count upon merging to main. If we really don't want to impact CI times by this much. Thoughts?

issueDTO.title: Question about LAM stage 2 didn't use text encoder
issueDTO.description:
I know there are some instructions in the paper that in stage1 the tasks are already decoupled, but the question is, why? Why doesn't LAM stage 2 have a text encoder? What if I want to do some further complicated tasks in stage2 specifically in the Nav task, for example, I need to specify the go - to target in the nav task?

Is there any further reason why stage 2 didn't have a text input condition?
comments: Finally, someone is asking this! Yes, keeping the text input seems more reasonable. Our final version is primarily an empirical choice. Initially, we kept the text input for the LAM encoder in stage 2 but found that dropping it performs better. You can try both designs in your own setting to see which one works best.

I'm very curious about this issue as well. 
- The 1st stage is called **task-irrelevant** while task instructions are provided. 
- The 2nd stage is called **task-centric** while task information is not given.
What are the reasons behind those terminologies?

Thanks for bringing this up! During the first stage of training, the strong information bottleneck created by the VQ-VAE codebook forces the learned latent actions to capture only the information not inferable from task instructions—resulting in task-irrelevant latent actions.

In the second stage, with these task-irrelevant latents frozen, the newly initialized latent actions are trained to replace the role of language, allowing them to learn task-centric dynamics.

This also explains why, in naive latent action learning approaches like LAPA and Genie, latent action tokens mostly encode motion/dynamics—since texture information is already preserved from previous frames for future frame prediction in the decoder.

If your goal is to learn task-relevant tokens, why not directly use contrastive learning to encode those tokens and perform a soft alignment with the text instruction features? Have you tried this approach? It seems like a more straightforward way to achieve your objective.

@retsuh-bqw Thanks for your detailed explanation.

To support your claims, I think it would be helpful to demonstrate what kind of behavior the latent actions actually exhibit. Have you tried comparing them in a way similar to LAPA Figure 13? Or perhaps visualizing the reconstructions like in LAPA Figure 14?

> If your goal is to learn task-relevant tokens, why not directly use contrastive learning to encode those tokens and perform a soft alignment with the text instruction features? Have you tried this approach? It seems like a more straightforward way to achieve your objective.

@dreamcubeblock We haven't tried this approach yet, but here's our reasoning: During a task episode, the latent action should evolve over time while the language instruction remains the same. Explicit contrastive alignment could harm convergence in this case, as it may be more suitable for learning latent actions that represent the entire task rollout rather than individual steps.

> [@retsuh-bqw](https://github.com/retsuh-bqw) Thanks for your detailed explanation.
> 
> To support your claims, I think it would be helpful to demonstrate what kind of behavior the latent actions actually exhibit. Have you tried comparing them in a way similar to LAPA Figure 13? Or perhaps visualizing the reconstructions like in LAPA Figure 14?

@JisuHann Thank you for your suggestion. While we cannot perform explicit reconstruction (since LAM operates in DINO space rather than raw pixels), we have conducted related analyses:

- Figures 8 & A-1 demonstrate that latent actions exhibit semantic consistency across environments and embodiments.

- Figure A-3 explores the attention patterns between latent actions and DINO features.

issueDTO.title: ailure to follow correct numbering
issueDTO.description:
If the titles are in the format [title] 1, [title] 2,..., [title] 10, it will sort [title] 1, [title] 10,..., [title] 2 instead of the correct ordering of 1, 2, 3,..., 10. This happened in left-to-right mode; I haven't tested it in Weebtoon mode.
It happened on a Kobo Clara HD.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c1f8e3d1-14bc-4654-a326-e986ff2e4e84)
comments:
This behavior was removed in

- #920

Sounds like we need to make it an option for cbz. 

It will order properly in epub kepub. Or use koreader. 

You can use 7.4 in meantime. 

I wonder if there's some other set of conditions we can trigger this behavior rather than an option, KCC already has a lot of options...

I would probably just do what I commented earlier, zero pad the numbers.

```python
def slugify(value):
    if options.format != 'CBZ':
        value = slugify_ext(value, regex_pattern=r'[^-a-z0-9_\.]+').strip('.')
    value = sub(r'0*([0-9]{4,})', r'\1', sub(r'([0-9]+)', r'0000\1', value, count=2))
    return value
```

nevermind, lots of people don't want zero padding either in the kcc discord... hmmm.

What if we did it in a way where it only zero pads if it would change the order? That's an idea. @orpheus1120 in case you have insight.

And it would only zero pad minimum amount...
OK, implemented above, please try it out. It will only zero pad and slugify if it would change the sort order, otherwise it leaves it untouched. @lalo101097 @orpheus1120

issueDTO.title: OpenAI Provider Integration
issueDTO.description:
**1. Overview:**

Ensure robust and up-to-date integration of the OpenAI API as a core LLM provider within the `voltagent` framework, utilizing the official `openai` Node.js SDK. This involves verifying support for the latest OpenAI models (GPT-4, GPT-3.5 variants), features (like tool calling, JSON mode), and ensuring the implementation aligns perfectly with the `LLMProvider` interface and `voltagent` conventions.

**2. Goals:**

*   Implement or verify a dedicated `OpenAIProvider` class adhering to the `LLMProvider` interface.
*   Support core generation functionalities (`generateText`, `streamText`, `generateObject`, `streamObject`) using OpenAI models.
*   Utilize the latest official `openai` Node.js SDK.
*   Correctly map `voltagent` generation options (model, temperature, max tokens, tool choice, etc.) to OpenAI API parameters.
*   Implement robust support for OpenAI's tool calling mechanism, mapping seamlessly to `voltagent`'s tool definition and execution flow.
*   Support OpenAI's JSON mode for reliable structured output generation (`generateObject`/`streamObject`).
*   Handle authentication using OpenAI API keys.
*   Integrate OpenAI-specific error handling and response parsing.

**3. Proposed Architecture & Components:**

*   **`OpenAIProvider`:** A class (potentially existing but needing review/update) within `agent/providers` implementing `LLMProvider`. It should:
    *   Use the official `openai` Node.js library.
    *   Handle API client initialization (API key, potentially base URL for proxies).
    *   Implement `generateText`, `streamText`, `generateObject`, `streamObject`, correctly formatting requests (messages, tools, model parameters) and parsing responses/streams.
    *   Specifically handle the `tool_calls` and `tool_results` message flow for tool usage.
*   **Provider Registration:** Ensure `OpenAIProvider` is correctly registered and selectable.
*   **Configuration:** Allow users to select 'openai' as the provider, specify models (e.g., 'gpt-4-turbo', 'gpt-3.5-turbo'), and provide API keys.
*   **Tool Mapping:** Refine the logic that translates `voltagent` tool definitions into the format expected by the OpenAI API's `tools` parameter and processes `tool_calls` responses.

**4. Affected Core Modules:**

*   `agent/providers`: `OpenAIProvider` class implementation/refinement.
*   `agent/types`: Ensure types accurately reflect OpenAI's request/response structures, especially for tools.
*   `ToolManager`: Interaction with `OpenAIProvider` for formatting tool definitions and handling tool calls.
*   `Agent`/`Agent Options`: Configuration for provider selection, models, and credentials.
*   Requires the `openai` dependency.

**5. Acceptance Criteria (Initial MVP / Refinement):**

*   Users can configure an `Agent` to use `OpenAIProvider` with various GPT models (e.g., GPT-4 Turbo, GPT-3.5 Turbo) and an API key.
*   `agent.generateText()` and `agent.streamText()` work correctly.
*   `agent.generateObject()` and `agent.streamObject()` utilize OpenAI's JSON mode successfully.
*   Agents can reliably use tools defined in `voltagent`, with requests and responses correctly handled via the OpenAI tool calling API.
*   Relevant options (temperature, max tokens, tool choice) are passed correctly.
*   Integration uses the current version of the official `openai` SDK.
*   Documentation reflects the updated/verified OpenAI integration details.

**6. Potential Challenges & Considerations:**

*   Keeping up with frequent updates and changes in the OpenAI API and SDK.
*   Ensuring the tool calling implementation is robust and handles various edge cases (multiple tool calls, errors).
*   Mapping `voltagent`'s internal state/history accurately to the sequence of messages expected by OpenAI, especially when including tool results.
*   Handling differences in behavior or features across different OpenAI models.
*   Cost management and monitoring token usage for OpenAI API calls.

issueDTO.title: Add "Rename" Button for Preset Management with Popup Modal
issueDTO.description:
Add "Rename" Button for Preset Management with Popup Modal

**Description:**
We need to add a "Rename" button between the ComboBox (for selecting presets) and the "Delete" button. When clicked, this button should open a popup modal asking the user to enter a new name for the selected preset. Upon confirming, the preset's name should be updated in the object (`presets.name`) and the associated file. The previous file with the old name should be deleted.

**Tasks:**

1. **Add the "Rename" button:**
   - Place the "Rename" button between the ComboBox (preset selector) and the "Delete" button.
   - Ensure the button is clearly labeled and fits within the existing layout.

2. **Implement the popup modal:**
   - Create a modal that appears when the "Rename" button is clicked.
   - The modal should include:
     - An input field for the new preset name.
     - "Confirm" and "Cancel" buttons.
   - The "Confirm" button should only be enabled if the input field is not empty.

3. **Handle renaming logic:**
   - Update the `presets.name` property with the new name when the user clicks "Confirm".
   - Rename the corresponding preset file to match the new name and delete the old file.
   - Ensure the file renaming is done safely, checking for any name conflicts or invalid characters.

4. **Update the ComboBox selection and display:**
   - Refresh the ComboBox options to reflect the updated preset name.
   - Maintain the current selection in the ComboBox with the new name after renaming.

5. **Test the renaming functionality:**
   - Verify that the "Rename" button opens the modal correctly.
   - Test renaming with various inputs (valid, invalid, empty, conflicting names).
   - Confirm that the file is renamed correctly and the old file is deleted.
   - Ensure the ComboBox updates to reflect the new name without issues.

6. **Update documentation:**
   - Document the new "Rename" functionality.
   - Update any relevant sections of the user guide to explain how to rename presets.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The "Rename" button appears between the ComboBox and "Delete" button and functions as intended.
- The popup modal asks the user for a new name, and the "Confirm" button only works when a valid name is provided.
- The preset's name is updated both in the object (`presets.name`) and the corresponding file.
- The previous file is deleted after renaming.
- The ComboBox correctly displays the updated preset name.
- Documentation is updated to reflect the new feature.

**Additional Context:**
- The project uses ImGui, and the modal should integrate seamlessly with the existing UI.
- Ensure that renaming presets does not interfere with other functionalities like saving, loading, or deleting presets.

issueDTO.title: Request for clearer error message parsing pyproject.toml
issueDTO.description:
### Issue Kind

Change in current behaviour

### Description

When the tool.poetry.source section in pyproject.toml is provided as a `[single table]` rather than `[[array of tables]]` the error poetry provides isn't very helpful:
```
The Poetry configuration is invalid:
  - data.source must be array
```

A more descriptive error and/or a reference to what section or line in the toml would be a little more friendly.  Tried this with -vvv and the stack trace also doesn't give a clue to what part of the toml is actually the problem.

A more broad way to phrase it, if you like,  might be "toml structure errors should report a line or section if possible" 

### Impact

Some more info in the error would make troubleshooting faster; as it is one either 'just knows' the expected structure or goes section by section, which might be slower or faster depending on the size of pyproject.toml.

### Workarounds

None that I'm aware of
comments:
> Landed on this issue after running into this myself.
> 
> [@Evan0000000000](https://github.com/Evan0000000000) , any chance you can post an example / description of solution as you've proposed. Other people may end up here too looking to understand what the error means.
> 
> I am one of those people, new to using poetry and I do not "just know" the solution. Additionally, OpenAI seems to strangely bounce you back-and-forth between two equally obscure error messages if you cut-and-paste the error & ask for assistance.

Hey Jeremy, sure, as an example, in pyproject.toml the `tool.poetry.source` section must be an array, like `[[tool.poetry.source]]` even if you only specify one source. This makes total sense as arrays with 1 entry are completely valid.  

The confusion is that poetry will give you the error in my original message, which tells you something should be an array but not _which_ something, so the solution currently is just to review your pyproject.toml file very carefully with respect to what each tool you have using it expects.

We already replace `data.` with `tool.poetry.` in https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry-core/blob/002aa3e16f98d21645bb9a45f698b55adc40f317/src/poetry/core/factory.py#L606-L609.

We probably have to do the same in https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/blob/aeaa3d09ce7381bf34ac7e0ac27b929841256c90/src/poetry/factory.py#L335.

repository.description: Python packaging and dependency management made easy
repository.name: poetry

summary.main: The issue is about requesting a clearer error message when parsing pyproject.toml, specifically when the tool.poetry.source section is provided as a [single table] rather than [[array of tables]].
summary.validationOrRequirement: The tool.poetry.source section in pyproject.toml should be an array, like [[tool.poetry.source]], even if there is only one source.
summary.attemptedFixes: The solution is to review the pyproject.toml file carefully with respect to what each tool using it expects, and the issue is already tracked in two different places: https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry-core/blob/002aa3e16f98d21645bb9a45f698b55adc40f317/src/poetry/core/factory.py#L606-L609 and https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/blob/aeaa3d09ce7381bf34ac7e0ac27b929841256c90/src/poetry/factory.py#L335.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the structure of pyproject.toml file where tool.poetry.source section should be an array, like [[tool.poetry.source]] even if there is only one source. Poetry provides an error message that is not very helpful, indicating that data.source must be an array but does not specify which part of the toml file is the problem.

issueDTO.title: Allow `CapacityLimiter` to have `total_tokens=0`
issueDTO.description:
Sometimes, there are use-cases where you want to entirely pause processing of some tasks, and then later scale back up.  `CapacityLimiter` is basically perfect for this kind of thing, except that it currently raises an error if you pass `total_tokens=0`:

https://github.com/python-trio/trio/blob/d988edd368f094855bd1c36442302113f45f2a1c/src/trio/_sync.py#L254-L255

It's already possible to get the desired effect just by deliberately "leaking" one of the tokens, but it would be much nicer to simply allow zero as the intended capacity, by editing the numbers in the setter above.

issueDTO.title: Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue (YAML/Docker)
issueDTO.description:
# Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue (YAML/Docker)
## Create a Configuration for a Multi-Service Application
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

## How to get started
Open the `tasks/yaml/medium` directory from the root of your project.
Then open up the `docker-compose.yml` file and once it is properly created according to the YAML syntax and the task in hand, you are done and ready to make a pull request!
*Note: You can test your YAML code in a editor like [this](http://www.yamllint.com/)*.

## Description:

Your task is to create a `docker-compose.yml` file that describes a multi-service application. This application should contain:

-   A web server running on port 8080 using the nginx image.
-   A database server running on the default port using the postgres image.

The web server should have access to the database server but not vice versa.

## Requirements:

-   Use Docker Compose version 3.
-   Specify service names, image versions, and exposed ports.
-   Set up a custom network and make sure only the web server can communicate with the database.
-   Use environment variables to set the database name, user, and password for the PostgreSQL service.

## Example Structure:

```yaml
version: '3'

services:
  # Define your services here
  
networks:
  # Define your networks here
```

## Evaluation Criteria:

-   Valid YAML syntax.
-   Correct use of Docker Compose version and features.
-   Correct network setup.
-   The web server should be able to connect to the database, but the database should not have access to the web server.

---

Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions and how to make a pull request.

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

#### Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!

issueDTO.title: A way/command to search position of the specified value in De Bruijn sequence
issueDTO.description: Imagine, we generated De Bruijn sequence using command `ppd 1024` (1024 bytes) and fed some vulnerable program it as input, then spotted one of the registers has a value that is part of the sequence. Instead of using round about ways ("wx `ppd 1024`; /x 0x414141") we could provide a shortcut for users to do that in the easiest way possible: `<cmd> 0x41414141` that will return the position in the sequence directly.

repository.description: UNIX-like reverse engineering framework and command-line toolset.

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] Create contributing guide video for use with YouTube, Instagram, and other social media
issueDTO.description:
### Problem or Use Case

We get very common questions re: how to assign and unassign issues, people that do not install the project, and people that make documentation PRs but do not create a rendered preview. It is clear that many contributors are not reading the contributing.MD or the documentation update readme. 

### Proposed Solution

We are a welcoming community and we would like to include all regardless of their learning methodology. Some read, others watch. So, we would like a video to welcome contributors and walk them through the basics of contributing to KubeStellar. Once completed, we can create a shortcut url and give it to anyone with a question about making a contribution. This saves everyone time.

### Are you willing to contribute?

- [ ] Yes, I'd like to help implement this feature.

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments: This sounds cool and a nice way to learn in public on how to contribute in the future. How can I help?

# Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue (Bash)

## Create a Bash Script to Monitor Disk Space and Send Email Alert
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

### Objective:
Create a Bash script that checks the available disk space on your machine. If the available space falls below a certain threshold, the script should send an email alert to a specified email address.

Requirements:
-   Threshold for low disk space should be configurable (e.g., below 20%).
-   The email should contain detailed information about the disk space status.
-   Use the `df` command for getting disk space information.
-   Use `mail` command to send email.

Next step is optional but if you would like to make this actually functional for email sending, you could use for example the mail command-line utility for that:

On Linux/Ubuntu:
```bash
sudo apt-get install mailutils
```

On macOS:
```bash
brew install mailutils
```

### To run the script:

Make sure you are in the correct directory with the command:
```bash
cd tasks/bash/medium
```

Ensure you have the required permissions to execute the script by running this command:

```bash
chmod +x disk_monitor.sh
```

Execute the script:

```bash
./disk_monitor.sh
```

---

To work with this issue, you need to have Bash installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing Bash and how to make a pull request.

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

#### Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!

issueDTO.description:
# Fork, Commit, Merge - Hard Issue (Python)

## Implementing a Decision Tree Classifier from Scratch
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

## How to get started

For this task you need to have Python and NumPy installed. Check out [Installing Python](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge#installing-python) section in README if you need to install Python. If you already have Python installed, you can install NumPy using pip (Python's package installer) with the following terminal command:

```bash
pip install numpy
```

Or, if you're using Python 3 specifically and have both Python 2 and Python 3 installed, you may need to use:

```bash
pip3 install numpy
```

After that you can open the `tasks/python/hard` directory from the root of the project. 
Then open `decision_tree.py` file and start working on your solution!

![python-hard](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/assets/82566656/3fc4a704-a734-4b90-90fc-476ab367b7a1)

## Description

Implement a Decision Tree Classifier from scratch using Python. Do not use libraries like scikit-learn that have pre-implemented classifiers; instead, use basic libraries like NumPy for numerical calculations.

Objectives:

-   Understand the theory behind Decision Trees.
-   Implement a simple yet functional Decision Tree Classifier.
-   Test the classifier on a dataset.

Use any freely available classification dataset. Ensure the dataset has at least 3 features and at least 2 classes.

Implementation Steps:
-   Write functions to calculate Gini impurity or Information Gain.
-   Implement a class DecisionTree with methods for fitting and predicting.
-   Implement a function to print/visualize the tree.

Testing:
-   Split the dataset into training and test sets and evaluate your classifier.

Acceptance Criteria:

-   Successfully implement a Decision Tree Classifier from scratch.
-   Evaluate the classifier on a dataset, showing reasonable performance metrics (e.g., accuracy, precision, recall).

Resources:

-   [Decision Trees - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decision_tree_learning)

## How to run

Make sure you are in the right directory:

```bash
cd tasks/python/hard
```

Execute the following command to run your Python script:

```bash
python decision_tree.py
```

## Expected output

Output should look similar to this:

```bash
The predicted class for the sample [0.4, 0.6] is 0.
```

If the output looks correct, you are ready to make a pull request!

---

To work with this issue, you need to have Python installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing Python and how to make a pull request.

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

#### Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!

issueDTO.title: Drill to Detail is not working properly on Charts powered by Jinja Templating
issueDTO.description:
### Bug description

## Description
Dashboard charts that are powered by Jinja are able to display their data correctly. However, when users try to perform the drill-by action, the result is incorrect.

## How to reproduce the bug
1. By following [**this guide**](https://preset.io/blog/intro-jinja-templating-apache-superset/#using-jinja-to-filter-data-walkthrough), create a Jinja-powered dataset with `country`, `status`, and `product_line` columns.
2. Create a stacked Bar Chart and add it to a dashboard.
3. Add a filter for the Product Line from the `Vehicle Sales` dataset.
4. Ensure that the dashboard shows correct data.
5. On the stacked Bar Chart, perform a **drill to detail by all** action.

## Expected results
Drill-by results are correct.

## Actual results
Drill-by results are incorrect.

## Known Workarounds
No workarounds are currently known.


### Screenshots/recordings

_No response_

### Superset version

master / latest-dev

### Python version

3.9

### Node version

16

### Browser

Chrome

### Additional context

_No response_

### Checklist

- [x] I have searched Superset docs and Slack and didn't find a solution to my problem.
- [x] I have searched the GitHub issue tracker and didn't find a similar bug report.
- [ ] I have checked Superset's logs for errors and if I found a relevant Python stacktrace, I included it here as text in the "additional context" section.
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This issue is caused by a disconnect between the context available to Jinja templates during regular chart rendering and what is provided during drill-to-detail actions. When you drill, the frontend sends a new request that often lacks the full dashboard/global context (like dashboard filters or URL params) that your Jinja SQL expects, so the template renders incorrectly or with missing values. This is a known limitation and has been discussed in several issues and code reviews ([example](https://github.com/apache/superset/issues/33591), [example](https://github.com/apache/superset/issues/33579)).

A workaround is to make your Jinja SQL more robust by using `if/else` blocks to provide default values when filters are missing, so the query always returns results and columns don't disappear. For example:

```sql
WITH calculation as (
  SELECT count(*), country
  FROM "Vehicle Sales"
  WHERE 1=1
  {% if filter_values('product_line') %}
    and product_line in {{ filter_values('product_line')|where_in }}
  {% else %}
    and product_line = 'Classic Cars'
  {% endif %}
  GROUP BY country
)
SELECT * FROM calculation
```
([source](https://github.com/apache/superset/issues/33591))

If your dataset relies on dashboard-level filters or variables, you may need to adjust your Jinja logic to handle cases where those are missing during drill actions.

There have also been recent changes to how Superset syncs dataset columns and processes Jinja templates, which can impact this behavior ([PR 30903](https://github.com/apache/superset/pull/30903)). Make sure your configuration enables `ENABLE_TEMPLATE_PROCESSING` and that your feature flags are up to date.

At this time, there is no full workaround for preserving all dashboard context in drill-to-detail requests, but making your Jinja SQL more defensive can help avoid empty or broken results.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To reply, just mention [@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).*

issueDTO.title: [BUG] The Backup YAML example in the Longhorn doc does not work
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the Bug

The Backup YAML example in [our doc website](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.9.0/snapshots-and-backups/backup-and-restore/create-a-backup) does not work. Because Longhorn mutator webhook requires providing [the correct `metadata.labels`](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn-manager/blob/16f796214eb359cdb9f9efbe577a2de68144081b/webhook/resources/backup/mutator.go#L63-L67) while the doc does not mention that.

There are 2 solutions for this:
- Simply updating the doc by adding `metadata.labels` for the example YAMLs
- The mutator should figure out and set up the labels automatically based on the input `spec.snapshotName`

Now I may prefer the latter one since this solution can both
- provide a better user experience
- and forcibly ask the mutator to check the volume and snapshot existence before backup creation

### To Reproduce

1. Create and attach a volume
2. Create a random snapshot
3. Apply the following backup YAML provided by the doc:
```
apiVersion: longhorn.io/v1beta2
kind: Backup
metadata:
  name: backup-example
  namespace: longhorn-system
spec:
  backupMode: full
  snapshotName: <volume snapshot name>
  labels:
    app: test
```

### Expected Behavior

The backup should be created correctly

### Support Bundle for Troubleshooting

```
ubuntu:~$ kubectl apply -f backup.yaml
Error from server (InternalError): error when creating "backup.yaml": Internal error occurred: failed calling webhook "mutator.longhorn.io": failed to call webhook: post "https://longhorn-admission-webhock.longhorn-system.svc:9502/v1/webhook/mutation?timeout=10s": EOF
```

### Environment

- Longhorn version: master-head (07/02/2025)

### Additional context

This issue was found by community contributor @nzhan126  when she tried to test a backup-related fix. 

### Workaround and Mitigation

Set up `matadata.labels` for the backup YAML. For example:
```
apiVersion: longhorn.io/v1beta2
kind: Backup
metadata:
  name: backup-example
  namespace: longhorn-system
  labels:
    backup-volume: <volume name>
spec:
  backupMode: full
  snapshotName: <volume snapshot name>
  labels:
    app: test
```

issueDTO.title: No sound on desktop notifications anymore ?
issueDTO.description:
I'm currently working with Tauri v2, and I'm trying to send notifications with sound on desktop platforms (macOS, Windows, etc.).

From the [v1 documentation](https://v1.tauri.app/v1/api/js/notification/#sound), it's clear that we could set a sound option for notifications:

> The sound file to play when the notification is shown.


However, in the [v2 documentation](https://v2.tauri.app/reference/javascript/notification/#options), the sound option is explicitly noted as:

> The sound resource name. Only available on mobile.


It seems that this functionality was either removed or not yet implemented for desktop in v2.


- Is there a plan to bring back desktop notification sounds support in v2?
- If not, could it be considered for a future release?

Thanks for the amazing work on Tauri!
comments: Oh damn. In alpha times we planned to bring this back before stable but completely lost track of it. This should be relatively easy to bring back since notify-rust has sound support and it should look quite similar to the v1 impl so probably a straight forward port.
Waiting for the PR to be merged, however got the sound working by adding a custom sound playback on when notification is sent!

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request]: Support for PP-OCRv5's New Model Format (inference.json, inference.pdiparams, inference.yml)
issueDTO.description:
### Request Description

PaddleOCR recently updated the model format for PP-OCRv5 . The previous format used three files:

> inference.pdmodel
> 
> inference.pdiparams
> 
> inference.pdiparams.info

The new format now consists of:

> inference.json
> 
> inference.pdiparams
> 
> inference.yml

This change breaks compatibility with OpenVINO’s current PaddlePaddle model support, which expects the legacy file structure.
Could the OpenVINO team confirm if there are plans to:
Add support for the new PP-OCRv5 model format?
PP-OCRv5 is a state-of-the-art OCR model widely adopted in production deployments.
Users upgrading to PP-OCRv5 will be blocked from leveraging OpenVINO’s optimizations without format compatibility.

### Feature Use Case

_No response_

- [x] The feature request or improvement must be related to OpenVINO

issueDTO.title: [Feature] add a page about using the H2 database
issueDTO.description:
### Feature Request

There is a page about MySQL.
https://hertzbeat.apache.org/docs/help/mysql/

From the mailing lists, there is evidence that some users are using Hertzbeat with H2 databases.

H2 Database is not meant to be used in production environments and has dangerous functionality that allows users to run scripts that can run raw Java commands - including very dangerous Java commands.

I would suggest that you read https://h2database.com/html/security.html - the really worrying bit is the 'CREATE ALIAS' bit. With CREATE ALIAS support, you let malicious users get full access to the Hertzbeat server and run shell commands.

Can we add a page that tells users that H2 support in Hertzbeat is meant for testing in sandboxed environment and it isn't meant for production?

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

_No response_

### Describe the solution you'd like

_No response_

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Automate manual post-installation steps for Docker setup
issueDTO.description:
## Issue Description

Currently, the Docker installation process requires several manual steps to be executed after running `docker-compose up --build -d`. These manual steps create friction for new users and go against Docker's principle of providing a complete, automated setup experience.

## Current Manual Steps

After running `docker-compose up --build -d`, users must manually execute:

```bash
docker exec -it samarium_app npm run dev
docker exec -it samarium_app composer dump-autoload
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan migrate
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan key:generate
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan storage:link
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan db:seed
```

## Expected Behavior

The Docker setup should be fully automated - users should only need to run:
1. `cp .env.docker.example .env`
2. `docker-compose up --build -d`

After these commands, the application should be ready to use without any additional manual intervention.

issueDTO.title: Introduce a meta scan function for inspecting table column size
issueDTO.description:
<!-- (At least include the following, feel free to add if you have more content) -->

## Feature request

StarRocks support several functions to inspect the metadata of segment files:
```sql
select count(id) from t1 [_META_];
select min(id) from t1 [_META_];
select max(id) from t1 [_META_];
select flat_json_meta(payload) from t1 [_META_];
```

Essentially it generates a `META_SCAN` operator to scan the metadata of underlying segment files, then aggregate the result with `count/min/max` functions.

We can leverage this mechanism to inspect the column size of a table, for example:

```sql
select column_size(id) from t1 [_META_];
```

There are several types of column sizes:  
- **Uncompressed Size**: Stored in the `ColumnMetaPB` located in the segment footer.  
- **Compressed Size**: Represents the on-disk size. While it is not explicitly stored in the footer, it can be estimated by analyzing the number of pages via the `OrdinalIndex` and calculating the average page size.  

It might be worthwhile to include a few functions for inspecting a column's metadata.

Further more, we can also consider add these column stats into the optimizer statistics system, stored in the `_statistics_.column_statistics` table.
comments: @murphyatwork , I'm interseted, could you kindly assign me this task.

repository.description: The world's fastest open query engine for sub-second analytics both on and off the data lakehouse. With the flexibility to support nearly any scenario, StarRocks provides best-in-class performance for multi-dimensional analytics, real-time analytics, and ad-hoc queries. A Linux Foundation project.
repository.name: starrocks

summary.main: Introduce a meta scan function for inspecting table column size, allowing users to inspect the column size of a table, including uncompressed and compressed sizes
summary.validationOrRequirement: Include a few functions for inspecting a column's metadata, and consider adding column stats to the optimizer statistics system
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue description or comments
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about introducing a meta scan function to inspect table column size, leveraging the existing `META_SCAN` operator and `ColumnMetaPB` in the segment footer. It also mentions considering adding column stats to the optimizer statistics system.
